instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no keyboard or trackpad
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, that after a while powered on, the keyboard and the trackpad stop working. 

If I connect an USB mouse and keyboard, and reboot the Mac, the internal keyboard and trackpad start to work for a while (one or two days), and them stop to work again, until connected the USB devices again, and the all process repeats again.

Any idea?

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no keyboard or trackpad
threads.message:
First, discard software issue.
Disconnect internal SSD and test with UAB macOS.

Also try known good trackpad flex/board.
